How to Install gengetopt on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • gengetopt

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install gengetopt on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing gengetopt on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall gengetopt in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install gengetopt, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install gengetopt Using apt

To install gengetopt in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install gengetopt using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install gengetopt

The installation of gengetopt might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install gengetopt Using apt-get

To install gengetopt using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install gengetopt.

sudo apt-get -y install gengetopt

Install gengetopt Using Synaptic

To install gengetopt using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install gengetopt on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for gengetopt. This will display the gengetopt package in the package window, now to install gengetopt, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the gengetopt package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of gengetopt.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install gengetopt Using aptitude

To install gengetopt on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of gengetopt.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install gengetopt using the command aptitude install gengetopt.

sudo aptitude -y install gengetopt

How to Upgrade gengetopt on debian

If you want to upgrade the gengetopt package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade gengetopt using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade gengetopt to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade gengetopt.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade gengetopt sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade gengetopt

Upgrade gengetopt using Aptitude

To upgrade gengetopt using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade gengetopt.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade gengetopt

Upgrade gengetopt using Synaptic

To upgrade gengetopt using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for gengetopt, now right-click gengetopt, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade gengetopt just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall gengetopt on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall gengetopt from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just gengetopt, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove gengetopt

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of gengetopt

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of gengetopt you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge gengetopt

Remove gengetopt using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall gengetopt using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for gengetopt, right-click the gengetopt package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall gengetopt click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install gengetopt on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade gengetopt using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of gengetopt then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
